content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"> <Esri> <CreaDate>20130529</CreaDate> <CreaTime>06553000</CreaTime> <ArcGISFormat>1.0</ArcGISFormat> <SyncOnce>TRUE</SyncOnce> </Esri> <dataIdInfo> <idAbs>The data for this service originates in the NWS River Forecast Centers (RFC). NWS River Forecast Centers use the best available forecasts for future precipitation amounts given the constraints of current hydrometeorological science. The number of hours or days into the future that precipitation can be realistically forecast varies across the United States with seasons and geographic area. For example, forecast rainfall amounts for hurricanes and large scale weather systems can extend farther into the future than they can for local summer thunderstorms. </idAbs> <searchKeys> <keyword>Flood</keyword> </searchKeys> <idPurp>fop</idPurp> <idCredit/> <resConst> <Consts> <useLimit>None</useLimit> </Consts> </resConst> <idCitation> <resTitle>Significant River Flooding Outlook</resTitle> </idCitation> </dataIdInfo> <Binary> <Thumbnail> <Data EsriPropertyType="PictureX"></Data> </Thumbnail> </Binary> </metadata>
